message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY

The paper involves the use of a neurobiologically plausible model to predict goals and enhance perception, which falls under the category of computational neuroscience (cs.NE). The task involves pairs of noisy MNIST digits, which suggests computer vision (cs.CV) as another likely sub-category. The use of an online learning model and attentional mechanisms also suggests artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG) as possible sub-categories. Finally, the goal-driven perception task can be seen as a control problem, which falls under the category of control systems (cs.SY).
